definition: to look for trouble
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
surname Ma
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties

sentences.english: His brother is a disturber of the piano keys .
sentences.chinese: 他哥哥是一個跟鋼琴找麻煩的人。

sentences.english: If you went looking for a former partner, you knew you were looking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你去找以前的伴侶，你知道自己是在找麻煩。

sentences.english: On his day-off Nara looks for trouble in Glass City.
sentences.chinese: 每逢假期，奈良就在格拉斯司迪裏找麻煩。

sentences.english: If you park on those yellow lines, you are really asking for it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把車停在黃線上，你就真是自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: He could make trouble for me if he wanted to.
sentences.chinese: 他要是想找麻煩就能給我找麻煩。

sentences.english: He could make trouble for me if he wanted to.
sentences.chinese: 他要是想找麻煩就能給我找麻煩。

sentences.english: You're just looking for trouble if you bring it to his attention.
sentences.chinese: 你讓他注意到這件事純粹就是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Are Marks and Hernandez gonna give us trouble?
sentences.chinese: 馬克和賀南德茲還想找麻煩？

sentences.english: Don't trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
sentences.chinese: 麻煩沒有來找你，別去自找麻煩。

sentences.english: The question of side effects, however, has nagged the vaccine.
sentences.chinese: 然而，副作用的問題，已經不斷的給疫苗找麻煩了。

sentences.english: Do this for lap after lap at a higher intensity and you're asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果這樣一圈圈地遊，那麼你是在自找麻煩。

sentences.english: Kids always make trouble on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們度假時老找麻煩。

sentences.english: If you climb moutains in fog, you're asking for trouble .
sentences.chinese: 如果你在霧中登山，那就是自找麻煩。

sentences.english: If you harm a hair of my daughter's head, you'll get yourself into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 你要是動我女兒一根毫毛，你可就自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: That's what gets them into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 那樣他們就算自找麻煩了。

sentences.english: 'I'd just give you one piece of advice the IRS wouldn't bother with, ' Andy said.
sentences.chinese: “我先給你一個不讓稅捐處找麻煩的法子，”安迪說。

definition: to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to play deaf-mute
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
idle gossip
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
